  "triples": [
    {"s":"polarized nuclear imaging framework", "p":"uses", "o":"suitable polarized radioisotopes", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"With this polarized nuclear imaging framework, we can perform both emission and transmission tomography simultaneously. However, to make this practical, we need suitable polarized radioisotopes, or tracers."},
    {"s":"xenon-131m", "p":"has", "o":"half-life of about twelve days", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"For example, xenon-131m has a half-life of about twelve days and a gamma emission energy around one hundred sixty-four kilo–electron volts."},
    {"s":"xenon-127m", "p":"has", "o":"half-life of sixty-nine seconds", "modalities":["text"], "confidence":1.0, "evidence":"Xenon-127m decays faster — with a half-life of sixty-nine seconds, emitting gamma rays between one hundred twenty-five and one hundred seventy kilo–electron volts."},

evidence: Xenon-127m decays faster - with a half-life of sixty-nine seconds, emitting gamma rays between one hundred twenty-five and one hundred seventy kilo-electron volts.
